titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Elias L. Magoon Papers, 1861-1885

publicationstmt.publisher: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Mark Seidl May 2021.

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

did.abstract: This collection consists of correspondence, reports, and other materials created or collected by Elias Magoon, most of which are related to the Vassar College Art Gallery.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Elias L. Magoon (1810-1886) was an American clergyman. A trustee of Vassar College from 1861 to 1886, he also served as chairman of the committee responsible for founding the Collegeâ€™s art gallery. In 1864, Magoon sold over 400 works of contemporary American and British art to Matthew Vassar, who insisted on the study of original works of art for the edification of the women who attended the new College. These works are now held at the Frances Lehman Loeb Art Center.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of correspondence, reports, and other materials created or collected by Elias Magoon, most of which are related to the Vassar College Art Gallery.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research according to the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library without any additional restrictions.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to quote (publish) from unpublished or previously published material must be obtained as described in the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library.

odd.head: Encoding Information
odd.p: Encoded by Mark Seidl, May 2021. Updated by Emma Gronbeck, October 2025.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Inventory created by Emma Iadanza, May 2021.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Elias L. Magoon Papers, Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries.
